result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott J. Dille was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
No contact with the named victim. 

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.

Obey all rules and regulations of the department.

Pay costs, fees, and any surcharges.

Credit in the event of revocation: 4

Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.

Sign up for probation today.

miscConds.notes:
Any and all fines, costs, surcharges, and restitution (if any ordered) to be paid directly by the Defendant to the Richland County Clerk of Court. Defendant has 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court. Failure to pay in full within 60 days or failure to stay current on an approved payment plan will result in entry of civil judgment with interest and submission of the debt to the Wisconsin Department of Revenue State Debt Collection (SDC) Unit.

Defendant to keep the Clerk of Court informed of any change in contact information (address and/or phone number).

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
11:20 AM Defendant Scott J. Dille in court.  Attorney Julie A Dadoun in court for Scott J. Dille.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Dadoun provides a plea questionnaire. Attorney Harper moves the court to amend count 1 to misd. bail jumping. Court amends the charge to 946.49(1). The joint recommendation is 1 year of probation, costs and no contact with the child victim. Court goes over the plea questionnaire. Attorney Harper asks that the offense date be amended to July 16, 2022. Court will amend the offense date. Defendant enters a NC plea. Attorney Harper and Attorney Dadoun heard. 

Court withholds sentence and orders probation for 1 year. 

Conditions:
No contact with the named victim. 

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.

Obey all rules and regulations of the department.

Pay costs, fees, and any surcharges.

Credit in the event of revocation: 4

Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.

Sign up for probation today.

Adjourned initial appearance on February 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:16 PM Attorney Julie A Dadoun appeared by video means for Defendant Scott J. Dille. Prosecuting Atty Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Scott J. Dille appeared by phone means. Attorney Dadoun just received the complaint but hasn't been able to speak with SD about it. Attorney Dadoun asks that the court modify the bond on the no contact with children. Court denies.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:22 PM - Cash bond be converted to a signature bond. No objection from the state. Court converts the cash bond to a signature bond.

While the case is pending, Defendant to pay $50/month to the Clerk of Court, first payment due 03/01/22. At the end of the case, Defendant will be required to fully reimburse Richland County. Failure to pay will result in collection actions by the clerk

10:07 AM - Attorney Harper appears by video means for the state. SD appears by phone. Attorney Dadoun appears by video and states that SD has contact her and asks to be appointed. Court appoint Attorney Dadoun. Attorney Harper  has just received the reports. Court set intial appearance for 02/14/22 at 1 PM
02/08/22; $5,000 cash bond set on 02/04/22 amended as follows: No contact with the alleged victim. No contact with anyone unders the age of 18.

1:21 p.m. No complaint yet. Atty. Forehand appears for the State. Def appears by phone, having posting bond. State asks for no contact with any minors as an addition to the bond. Court so orders. Def does not qualify for SPD; believes that Atty. Dadoun is being appointed to him. Court resets this matter to 2/10/22 at 10 a.m. Def to sign the new bond at dispatch by tomorrow (Wed). 

Clerk emailed the amended bond to RCSD at 1:40 p.m. Clerk notes that Atty. Dadoun has not yet been formally appointed to this Def as the Court has not yet made an appointment on counsel. Atty. Dadoun confirms that she plans to be present for the next hearing on 2/10/22 at 10 a.m. and has been informed that the Def needs to sign a new bond at the sheriff's dept.
By FS
To Those Posting Cash Bond

1:02 p.m. Appearances by video/zoom: DA Harper for the State, Defendant in jail, Atty. McDougal for the Def. Recommendation on bail from the State: $25,000 cash bond plus no contact with the named victim on the victim sheet (to be sealed). VWC Fields addresses the Court on behalf of the victim. Defense - Def can't post that bond; no objection with no contact and no contact with minor females; asks for lesser cash bond. State asks, if lower bond is set, that the Def be on house arrest/not to leave his home. Defense - okay with that if he be allowed to work. State - then the State persists on high cash. Court's sets bond at 5k cash with no contact conditions with the alleged victim. Atty. M states, if the Def is working, he won't qualify for SPD. Initial set for 2/8 at 1 p.m.
No contact with the alleged victim.
Victim Key
